intro: Eriocaulon decangulare var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaf marsh grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist habitats, thriving in nutrient-rich soils. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. The variety minor is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to the typical form of Eriocaulon decangulare.
